label: feel under the weather

label: throw in the towel

label: in the same boat
definition: in the same situation (usually difficult) (“We’re all stressed about the deadline –

label: burn the midnight oil
definition: work late into the night (“She burned the midnight oil studying for the exam.”)

label: through thick and thin

label: blow off steam

label: Money and Finance cost an arm and a leg
definition: be very expensive (“These designer shoes cost an arm and a leg.”)

label: break the bank
definition: to cost too much money (“We can have a nice dinner without breaking the bank.”)

label: a cash cow
definition: an easily profitable product or business (“That smartphone model turned into the company’s cash cow.”)

label: a drop in the bucket
definition: a very small amount (especially compared to what’s needed) (“Our donation was a drop in the bucket for the charity.”)

label: in the red
definition: losing money, unprofitable (“After the holidays, many businesses are in the red.”)

label: in the black
definition: financially profitable, not in debt (“After a good year, the company is finally in the black.”)

label: pay an arm and a leg for something
definition: pay a lot of money (“He paid an arm and a leg for that vintage car.”)

label: pinch pennies
definition: to be very careful or thrifty with money (“We had to pinch pennies to save for our vacation.”)

label: tighten your belt
definition: spend less money than usual (“With my pay cut, I’ll have to tighten my belt for a while.”) (idiom about budgeting)

label: go Dutch
definition: each person paying for themselves (especially on a date or group meal) (“Let’s go Dutch on the dinner bill.”)

label: all ears
definition: very attentive, fully listening (“Tell me your news–I’m all ears!”)

label: cold feet
definition: nervous hesitation to do something planned (“He got cold feet and almost didn’t go through with the wedding.”) (idiom for sudden doubt)

label: keep an eye on
definition: watch carefully, take care of (“Please keep an eye on my bag while I go to the restroom.”)

label: head in the clouds
definition: daydreaming; not paying attention to reality (“He’s got his head in the clouds, always fantasizing.”)

label: kick the bucket
definition: (slang, humorous) to die (“He’s nearly 100 but not ready to kick the bucket yet!”)

label: put your foot in your mouth
definition: say something inadvertently offensive or stupid (“I really put my foot in my mouth when I mentioned her ex-husband.”)

label: stab someone in the back
definition: betray someone (“I thought I could trust my colleague, but he stabbed me in the back.”)

label: cool as a cucumber
definition: very calm, especially when surprising ( “She was cool as a cucumber during the crisis.” )

label: a couch potato
definition: a very lazy person who watches too much TV (“Don’t be a couch potato–let’s go for a hike.”)

label: bring home the bacon
definition: earn the family living/money (“He works two jobs to bring home the bacon.”)

label: in hot water
definition: in trouble (“She’s in hot water with her boss for missing the meeting.”)

label: spill the beans
definition: reveal a secret (“We planned a surprise, but Tom spilled the beans.”)

label: food for thought
definition: something to think about (“That presentation gave me food for thought.”)

label: take something with a grain of salt
definition: to be skeptical about something (“I take online reviews with a grain of salt.”) (common idiom, cautioning disbelief)

label: the icing on the cake
definition: an additional benefit (on top of an already good thing) (“The free dessert was the icing on the cake of a great meal.”)

label: raining cats and dogs
definition: raining very heavily (“We canceled the picnic; it was raining cats and dogs.”)

label: every cloud has a silver lining
definition: there’s something good in every bad situation (“I lost my job, but every cloud has a silver lining – I have time to finish my degree now.”)

label: the calm before the storm
definition: a quiet time just before chaos or difficulties (“The students were unusually quiet – likely the calm before the storm of exam week.”)

label: a storm is brewing
definition: signs of trouble or conflict on the way (“You could tell a storm was brewing between the business partners.”)

label: weather the storm
definition: survive a difficult situation (“Our company will weather the storm of this recession.”)

label: break the ice
definition: do or say something to relieve tension or get conversation going (often among strangers) (“He told a joke to break the ice at the meeting.”)

label: throw caution to the wind
definition: take a risk and stop worrying (“I threw caution to the wind and drove 100 mph.”)

label: out of the woods
definition: out of danger or difficulty (“Her surgery went well, but she’s not out of the woods yet.”)

label: beat around the bush
definition: avoid getting to the point; talk indirectly (“Stop beating around the bush and answer the question.”)

label: take into account
definition: to consider or remember something when judging a situation (“We must take weather conditions into account when planning the event.”)

label: on account of
definition: because of (“The game was postponed on account of rain.”)

label: in actual fact
definition: actually; in reality (used to emphasize a truth contrasting an assumption) (“People think it’s easy, but in actual fact it’s quite challenging.”)

label: add to
definition: to increase or enhance (“This error adds to our problems.”)

label: all of a sudden
definition: suddenly; unexpectedly (“All of a sudden, the dog started barking.”)

label: all along
definition: the entire time; from the beginning (“I knew all along that they were plotting something.”)

label: all in all
definition: overall; considering everything (“There were some issues, but all in all it was a good performance.”)

label: all over the place
definition: everywhere; in a very disorganized state (“Your toys are all over the place–please tidy up.”)

label: on the one hand... (on the other hand)
definition: used to present two contrasting points or perspectives (“On the one hand we need more staff, but on the other hand we can’t afford the salaries.”)

label: take charge
definition: to assume control or responsibility (“She took charge of the project when the manager left.”)

label: in charge
definition: in control; responsible for (“He is in charge of customer service.”) (similar usage as take charge)

label: hand in hand
definition: together; simultaneously (“Economic development must go hand in hand with environmental protection.”)

label: up to
definition: someone’s decision or responsibility (“It’s up to you to accept the offer or not.”)

label: as far as I know
definition: to the best of my knowledge (“As far as I know, the meeting is still on Friday.”)

label: to be honest
definition: speaking frankly (“To be honest, I didn’t like the movie that much.”)

label: by the way
definition: incidentally (used to introduce a new topic or a reminder) (“By the way, have you seen my keys anywhere?”)

label: so to speak
definition: as one might say; in a manner of speaking (“He was a rockstar at coding, so to speak.”)

label: at the end of the day
definition: ultimately; in the final analysis (“At the end of the day, we have to decide if the plan is feasible.”)

label: last but not least
definition: lastly (important, though mentioned last) (“Last but not least, I want to thank our volunteers.”)

label: however
definition: contrasts with a previous statement (“I usually love parties; however, I won’t be able to attend tonight.”)

label: nevertheless
definition: in spite of that; even so (a strong “however”) (“It was raining, but nevertheless we enjoyed the picnic.”)

label: on the other hand
definition: presents an opposing point or consideration (“I could take a vacation. On the other hand, I might save the money for a house.”)

label: in contrast
definition: introduces a contrasting idea (“She is very outgoing; in contrast, her brother is quite shy.”)

label: moreover
definition: adds an additional point (reinforcing) (“The product is affordable; moreover, it’s eco-

label: in addition
definition: additionally; as an extra point (“The library has books. In addition, it offers free computer use.”)

label: besides
definition: apart from; also (“I’m too tired to go out, and besides, I’ve already seen that movie.”)

label: therefore
definition: for that reason; consequently (“It’s forecast to snow heavily, therefore the flight is canceled.”)

label: thus
definition: as a result; in this way (“He didn’t study; thus, he failed the exam.”)

label: as a result
definition: therefore; because of what was just mentioned (“The road was flooded; as a result, we had to turn back.”)

label: despite
definition: in spite of (“Despite the traffic (in spite of the traffic), we arrived on time.”)

label: in spite of
definition: despite (“In spite of feeling sick, he went to work.”)

label: although
definition: even though; despite the fact that (“Although it was cold, we went hiking.”)

label: even though
definition: stronger form of although (“Even though I was hungry, I didn’t eat the cake.”)

label: whereas
definition: while on the contrary (“He likes classical music, whereas his wife prefers jazz.”)

label: provided
definition: on the condition that (“You can go to the party, provided that you finish your homework.”)

label: as long as
definition: provided that; if (“I’ll remember that, as long as I live.” or “You can borrow the car as long as you’re careful.”)

label: in order to
definition: with the purpose/aim of (“She moved to the US in order to study at Harvard.”)

label: so that
definition: with the result or purpose that (“I’ll explain again so that everyone understands.”)
